turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Ann Arbor isn't... that far from Cleveland, right?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Nah. Once I get my own wheels, I could come up all the time.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: That'd be great. Hey, maybe someday your band'll play there. It's a college town, you know?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I feel like such an idiot. Why didn't I just say something a year and a half ago? Man, think of how much time we wasted.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Let's not think about the past. Let's just think about from today on. I'll never forget you, Jam.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Tell me about it. Church will never be the same again.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Coming dad.  I'll call you. Soon as we get a phone. Bye.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Oh, great. I just hitched a ride with a bunch of potheads... I'm hooking up with some people at this funky place in downtown Detroit called Disco Inferno. Mind droppin' me there?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: What's it worth to you?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: So, are you, like, gonna polish our nobs, or what?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: What? That's disgusting!

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Tease? What the hell did I do to tease you mongoloids?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: You got in the car, didn't you?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Oh, God, how calculating of me to lead you all on like that after you offered me a ride in the middle of nowhere.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Whatever... stella.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What are you, high?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: For once Lex is right. It's over. Things can't get any worse from here.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Wonder if you could smoke shit out of this?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Maybe some tunage'll chase those blues away.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: This is the best thing that ever happened to me at school! Not only are we on again for KISS in Detroit, but we're actually sitting right at the fifty yard line! I dare you dudes to find a curlier scenario.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Stan Lee couldn't think of a better one.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Namely?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Our band "Mystery" is a quartet and we can't go on the road without our drummer. Jam's mom said something about sending him to St. Bernard's, right? We gotta bust him out before we go anywhere.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Well, the least we, his only buds in the world, can do is take him along with us tonight and give him one last curl before he starts serving his sentence.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Just for the record, I understood the last part of what you said, but for a while there you guys were making no fucking sense whatsoever.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I was just explaining to Lex here what you and I already know. Just had to make it a little more complicated so he'd understand.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: I'm starvin' and it's way past lunchtime.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Totally. All I've had for chow was a packet of Pop Rocks and a Yoo-hoo.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Let's stop in Sandusky, Hawk.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What's in Sandusky?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Pizza, and I been jones-in' for a pizza ever since we left St. Bernard's.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You call that John Travolta/Denny Terio shit dancing? I wouldn't dance like that in private if you paid me.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Disco blows dogs for quarters.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What was that D.J.'s name again?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Oh, I'll remember it till the day I die. His name was... Simpleton the Simian? No, Samson Samoan... No, simply, similar...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I have one question. How could a kid who wails on the drums like it's the only thing keeping him alive even think of such a femmy thing to say?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Really, Jam, you tryin' to make us barf?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: So maybe we got enough for one ticket. Fuck!

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Waitaminit, dudes! I got it! We find four really small kids, beat the shit outta them and steal their tickets. What do you think?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Brilliance, Trip. Sheer brilliance. Give Albert Einstein here the Nobel Prize.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: ...at twenty-thirty hours.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: One more time in English.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: For the next hour and a half it's every dude for himself. Try to get at least one ticket and at 8:30 P.M. we'll meet over there.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Any luck?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Plenty, but it was all bad.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Will somebody please tell those chicks disco is dead.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Stellas. I hate stellas almost as much as I hate dogs.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Shit, that dork is Jam.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: YO, DOOFUS!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Yeah, she gives you shit and you take it.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Okay, enough. Enough. Gimme the tickets. I wanna hold onto them.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Second floor girls' john! Two minutes! He'll never look there!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Check!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: That's Sherry VanHafton.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I've been in love with her since the second grade.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Whoa... she just farted.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I have never heard a girl squeeze cheese in my entire life.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Weird...

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Too bad we're stuck in electronics or...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Never mind with the too bad shit. I got a crazy plan, but only the craziest among us can pull it off.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: But... but, St. Bernard's is way the hell over in the next county!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: So? Your mom's car has a CB, radar detector and cruise control, check?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: We are not stealing my mom's car.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Damn straight we are.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Hawk, all I need is one ding on the Volvo and presto! There are my balls hanging from the rearview mirror after she gets back from Cincinnati.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: And when is she due back from that groinecologist's convention anyway?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Sunday, but...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Then lighten up. She'll never know we touched it. Alright, here's the plan. We bus it to chez Lex, grab the Volvo, bail Jam the hell outta St. Bernard's and arrive at the train station precisely on time for the 2:45 to Detroit.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: There's only so much trouble an individual can get into till it just doesn't matter anymore, Lex. You familiar with a condition known as Absolute Zero?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: The hypothetical temperature characterized by the absence of heat and even the slightest amount of molecular activity? Yeah, I'm vaguely familiar

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Well, Jam is in absolute trouble. He couldn't get any deeper into shit if he was a fly sitting in a horse's ass. You know as well as me he'd give his right arm just to see Peter Criss's drum solo, never mind a whole KISS concert, check?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Very funny, Hawk. Okay, I'm in on this hare-brained scheme, but if anything happens to my mom's car, I'm blaming you. I'll say you drugged me or something.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Curly.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Ok, dudes, follow my lead.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Wait a minute. We ditching the rest of school?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Now, how are we gonna do this?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Gimme a second, dudes. Lemme think.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: We got you a change of duds when we picked up the car.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Next stop: the 2:45 to Detroit Rock City!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Jeezis, Hawk, can you at least keep it within twenty miles of the speed limit?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Lex, am I gonna have to lock you in the trunk till we reach Detroit? Don't worry, these babies are built for speed.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What the fuck!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: The paint!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Uh... dudes?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Now there's a woman who totally abuses the privilege of motherhood.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: DUDES!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Here's a suggestion. Let's stop worrying about the concert for the time being and get the cops in on this Volvo situation.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Wake up, Lex. This is Detroit. The cops aren't gonna waste city dollars looking for a Swedish car. Face it, the Volvo's on a cutting board as we speak getting sliced, diced, and julienned by Christine, the chop shop gourmet.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Now listen up. Here's the game plan.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: ...I mean, my mom's got insurance. What's the worst thing she could do? Ground me for the entire year? I can handle that...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Cool, bro, now listen up...

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: ...Holy shit! I am in absolute trouble! I never should have let you drive, man! Absolute fuckin' trouble!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Okay, shut the fuck up, Lex! Now, then, step number one, we find us a scalper. I got...  twenty-five.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I think we should try sneaking in.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Four dudes sneaking in? We'd get busted fer sure. Bad plan.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Okay, one of us sneaks in, gets four ticket stubs off some kids in the audience, comes back out, and we all "re-enter" the concerto. Voila!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Still too risky for my money.  We're running out of time here. This is KISS! A victory for one is a victory for the team. I'm sure I can barter with a scalper, but if you dudes think you got better plans, go for it. We'll reconvene at that intersection...

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I found the Volvo.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Tickets?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: No... You don't think...?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Nah. Couldn't be.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Do you realize the sheer, goddamn, unadulterated, undiluted, no holds barred, one hundred percent pure as Ivory Snow, absolutely friggin' STUPIDITY of what you just did?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Hey, disco dude, it's cool...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Could be.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: And if it ain't cleaned off?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Are you gettin' wise with me?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: No, I'm dumber than a goddamn slug. Now can I please clean your windshield and leave without further ado?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Well, let's recap, shall we? You slapped all of us, yelled at me, used my head for a rag, threw me on the ground and tossed our LOVE GUN 8- track under the wheels of a passing semi.  So, if the lesson was that you're a dick with ears and a really bad haircut, then, yes... I'd say we learned it.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Excuse me, I'm a little deef-a- hearin'. Can you repeat yourself?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Okay. Ahem! You. Are. A. Dick. With. Ears. And. A. Really. Bad. Haircut.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Oh, yeah...?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: How would you like a nice Hawaiian Punch?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Dude, this is all I got.

turns.speaker: SCALPER
turns.text: Sorry, man, no can do. But I'll be here for a while if you scare up the extra gravy.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Where the hell am I gonna scare up that kinda gravy in one hour?

turns.speaker: SCALPER
turns.text: The easy way.

turns.speaker: SCALPER
turns.text: You look a little scrawny, but it's worth a shot.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I can't just walk in and take my clothes off. It's embarrasskin.

turns.speaker: SCALPER
turns.text: Guess you don't want to see the greatest show on earth. And in Detroit no less. Well, take care, chief.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Dude, if it were dancing the way Fred Astaire did it, I'd give it my best shot. I'd learn the steps and practice in my spare time. But this... tribal, ritualistic bullshit, it's way-too-spontaneous for me.

turns.speaker: SCALPER
turns.text: Yeah, you're probably too young anyhow.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Hey, I invented fake I.D.s, alright. That's not the problem... They're playing disco music in there, man.

turns.speaker: SCALPER
turns.text: Chief, here's a little secret. Drink heavily, your feet will know what to do. Now shit or get off the pot. Do you wanna dance or do you wanna see KISS only on their album covers?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Jam, listen up.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Hawk?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Just listen up, man, cause we are in a quandary.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Are you on the crapper with one of those antenna phones? Sounds like you're taking a dump the size of Butte, Montana.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: It's my Bullworker.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Anyway, listen up. They're gone!

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: What's gone?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: The KISS tickets, you nimrod! They're just fuckin' gone! Please tell me you have'm!

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Gone!? Why would I have the KISS tick...?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Just check whatever you were wearing last night. Now!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I'm really sorry about that, man.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Don't be a fembot. So, are you like grounded because of last night, or what?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Of course, but has that ever stopped me before? Besides, my mom's going to some church meeting and won't be back till late. No sweat... See you guys in school.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: They're still at my house in Trip's jacket.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: They're what?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: She was standing right over me when I was changing for fuck's sake.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Don't worry about it. They're perfectly safe. We can pick them up after school. My mom won't be home. It's no problem.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: All right. After school we double- time it to your house for the tix before heading to the train station for the 2:45 to Detroit Rock City.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Check.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: If he offers you a slice, you're not the least bit hungry, check?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Check.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Don't you think we should at least pull over and offer to clean it off?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What?! Are you mentally deranged, Jam?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Oh no, Jam. I'm not falling for that twice.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Well, couldn't you slow down so I can at least state my case, Hawk? If you don't like it, you can speed up and I'll never mention it again.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: It doesn't mean anything. Don't pay attention to him.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Disco Inferno? Disco's infernal morelike.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Hey, Look at the front entrance! A car's pulling out. The parking space from heaven. God is surely smiling down upon us tonight, dudes.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Kind of funny, I thought He'd be pissed as hell at me.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry, Trip. What you made was a big, brainless, pile of horse shit. No offense.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Guys, GUYS! Come on, if this is anyone's fault, it's mine. I was the one who grabbed Trip's jacket by mistake. It's my fault and I apologize.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Please, Jam, we're trying to vent some hostility here. Sure the whole thing may be your fault, but who's gonna get pissed off at you?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: It was stolen!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Christine stole it! Asleep, my ass! The stella booted with your mom's wheels.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I'm sorry, guys. I thought it was a nice thing to do.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Jam, not another word out of your femmy-ass mouth! Okay, we're here, we got nothing, and we got an hour and a half. We're totally committed. It's time to brainstorm.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I got...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Uh-uh. Don't tell us, Jam. Just show us.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Wait! I know how we can get in!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Jam, shut-up! You're not allowed to speak, remember? Go use whatever femmy idea you have to get yourself a ticket or four. I don't wanna hear it.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: But... my plan involves all four of us acting together.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: See you at 8:30, Jam. Later.  Dudes? Later.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Well... I still got my idea if anybody will let me speak.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Go ahead, Jam.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: We all beat each other up, then, once we're nice and bruised, we run over to the ticket takers and say we got mugged and our tickets were stolen. They gotta let us in then.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Oh, hi, mom.

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: NOW!

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: Jeremiah, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Uhh... nothing.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Ahh, sunshine.

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: You're going to be late if you don't hurry up and change soon.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Change? What's wrong with what I got on?

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: It's dirty laundry for one thing and for another, you still haven't worn the clothes I bought you. You're skating on thin ice already, young man, so I wouldn't push my luck. Now get out of those rags.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: But, mom!

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: Besides, those jeans are so tight I can see your penis.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: They're not idiots.

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: Now don't forget you're on the honor system tonight. I'll be home a little after one and if you've been partying or playing that satanic KISS music... well, need I remind you of the consequences?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Grounded for the rest of the year?

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: You're a smart boy, Jeremiah. And so handsome.

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: I made an appointment with Father Phillip McNulty at St. Bernard's. We're to see him directly where he will register you on the spot.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: You mean, you're sending me to... b- b-boarding school?

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: What else can I do? Oh, records and magazines and comic books are one thing, but tickets? TICKETS? Jeremiah, do you realize what this means? That you're no longer content merely hearing their awful songs or looking at photos of their horrific faces! Now you want to see the devil in the flesh. You want to reach out and touch pure evil... and in Detroit no less!

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: Someday you'll have a son just like you, Jeremiah. A boy who lies through his teeth, buys demonic records, and smokes the dope just like you.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: If I'm anything like you, I'll deserve him.

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I said, I'm sorry!

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: If you truly are sorry, son, then you better pray like you've never prayed before. God willed me to find those tickets because He wanted to hear from you.  He knows you need help and He wants you to ask Him for it.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Mom, what're we...?

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: Just keep your lying, heathenous trap shut, Jeremiah.

turns.speaker: MRS. BRUCE
turns.text: Jeremiah... what's gotten into you?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I just lost my virginity in a confessional booth! Lord have mercy!!

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Forgive me, Father, for I have sinned. This is my first confession in... well... a really long time.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Prepare to receive the Act of Penance. How many sins have you committed since your last confession?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Just one, Father, but boy was it a doozy.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: So, you see if it wasn't for me, me and my friends would be at that KISS concert right now... together.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Well, this is a unique confession to say the least, son. And not exactly the most interesting one I've ever heard either. You sure you don't want to talk about... oh, carnal knowledge with a neighborhood girl or impure thoughts about the new student teacher maybe... or how about finding a box of magazines under your dad's bed?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Well then, I suggest you have a seat on the bench behind you and think of something a little juicier to confess than losing KISS tickets. I realize this is Detroit, but I personally find, what that rock and roll band is all about, to be boring as Lucifer's kingdom. I'll return in a little while.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Okay, you better have something really sinful for me this time, son. My patience is worn to threads and your mom will be here any minute.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Alright, Father, here it is. About two weeks ago I went to my cousin's wedding and one of the bridesmaids asked me if I wanted to take a bath.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I was insulted, so I asked her if I was wreaking some wicked b.o., right? Then she said no, she wanted to take a bath with me.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Oh, this is terrible... Please go on.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Well, she was a very tempting siren, Father. Built like you wouldn't believe. So I gave into temptation about a block away from the wedding reception at this little motel that charges by the hour.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Well? Continue! Continue!

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Okay... when she peeled off that gown, you'll never guess what she was wearing underneath.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Was it a teddy?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: No. Much bet... I mean, much more sinful than that.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: A bustier?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Tell you what. You keep guessing and I'll say something when you get it.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Splendid! I love a good game of Name That Nightie.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Jam has yet to do an overnight with us.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I had a nightmare once that something like this might happen. I hope he doesn't get grounded again. If he misses Peter Criss's drum solo, I don't know if he'll be able to handle it.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Poor, Jam, man. Imagine having to stash your KISS records inside Carly Simon album covers. No question, Mrs. Bruce is a psycho-bitch from hell.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: You're one to talk, Lex. Your mom's a fuckin' dyke.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Trip, a female gynecologist does not a lesbian make. And even if it did, at least my mom didn't give birth to me while she was on LSD.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Shrooms! And even if it was LSD, I can still give my mom a kiss without smelling the catch of the day.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Trip, you fuckin' asshole.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Yeah, right. She wishes. Look at that big ass.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: You know what they say about a big ass... big shit.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: That's some sick shit right there. Did she comb your ass hair for you too?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: If your mom so much as smells those tickets, they're history, and we get screwed outta seeing KISS for the third year in a row, the third year!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I knew it! I knew this was gonna happen! I had a bad feeling since last night. Remember? We are so totally fucked!

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Waitaminit, dudes! I got it! Maybe we can glue the tickets back together!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Hey, take it easy, man. This is the girls' crapper, remember?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Wake up, Lex! We just watched Jam's mom torch our fuckin' KISS tickets! Not REO Speedwagon! Not Journey! Not the Bay City Rollers! KISS! If you can think of a better reason to trash a bathroom, I'd sure like to hear it!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Trip, it's not the end of the world, okay? Quit acting all squeezed out.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Oh, everything's hunky-dory now that the shit hit the fan just like you said it would, you snug sonofabitch! You fuckin' jinxed us!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Smug, Trip! Not snug, smug.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: I did it! I did it! We won!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: We won?!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: The Chinese have a proverb: "That which appears too good to be true, usually is." There's gotta be a catch.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Yeah? I have a saying too, Lex. It goes, "Catch my jizz in your mouth and stop jinxing us, asshole." We're going this time and that's all there is to it.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Simplicity, Hawk.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Simple-icity is more like it. And you guys thought Jam was in trouble before. Wait till Mrs. Bruce finds out he went to that concert with us.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: About fuckin' time if you ask me. I'm just going through the motions till I drop out anyway.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Hello summer detention.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Well, here we are back at fucking school again.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Huh. St. Bernard's. Figures it's named after a canine.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Eyowch! This is one hot pizza!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Trip, huck that out before it stains the upholstery!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Man, that weed knocked Christine on her ass. She's sleeping like a baby stella.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Let's lift up her shirt.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Really, Trip, can we bore holes in your head and use it as a bong so it actually does us some good for a change?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Fuck you, Lex! This whole thing wouldn't have happened if it wasn't for you jinxing us. I just made an honest mistake.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: It's gone.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I can see that, bright boy. What happened to it?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: But we took the keys?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Damn, she musta hot wired it. We picked up a professional car thief in the shape of Olivia Newton-John!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Okay, I'm just a little mad now! Jam, why'd you talk us into picking that bitch up in the first place!?

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Twenty-five more'n I got.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: All I got is five. The rest is in the Volvo.

turns.speaker: LITTLE KID
turns.text: Please sir, don't beat me up. I do have a KISS ticket, but not on me.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: A likely story. Hand it over, kid.

turns.speaker: LITTLE KID
turns.text: No really. My brother's hanging onto it for safe keeping. Please, let me get him for you.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Hey, kid, that's okay. I don't wanna see KISS that ba...

turns.speaker: LITTLE KID
turns.text: Don't try to run, maggot. Chongo's an all-state track star in every event.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: LITTLE KID
turns.text: A tag on your toe. Nobody threatens me and lives.

turns.speaker: TRIP
turns.text: Look, you can have my wallet...

turns.speaker: LITTLE KID
turns.text: It's not nearly enough, punk.
